parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To remember, call to mind, recall, mention. A prolonged form of mnaomai; to remind, i.e. to recall to mind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and potheo; to dote upon, i.e. Intensely crave possession.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
